channel.description: A function in Scala is analogous to a method in Java or C# â€“ it is a named body of commands that does significant work. It may take one or more parameters and/or return a value. Recall the syntax for a function in Scala: def functionName(paramList): returnType = { } We will use the keyword Unit (like void in other languages) for a function that does not return a value.
